text: The FIFA Arab Cup (Arabic: ), or simply known as the Arab Cup, is a football (soccer) tournament held between countries in the Arab world. It has been organized by FIFA since 2021. Iraq has been the most successful team because they won 4 tournaments. The first tournament was played in Lebanon in 1963. Morocco won the most recent tournament, which occurred in 2012. == Results == Team Titles Runners-up 3rd Place 4th Place Semi-finalists Top 4 4 (1964, 1966*, 1985, 1988) – 1 (2012) – – 5 2 (1998, 2002) 1 (1992) 1 (1985) 1 (2012) – 5 1 (1992) – 1 (1988) – – 2 1 (2012) – – – 1 (2002) 2 1 (1963) – – – – 1 – 3 (1963, 1966, 1988) – 1 (1992) – 4 – 2 (1964, 2012) 1 (1966) – – 3 – 2 (1985, 2002) – – – 2 – 1 (1998) – 1 (1985) – 2 – – 3 (1964, 1992, 1998) 1 (1963) – 4 – – 1 (1963) 2 (1964, 1966) – 3 – – – 1 (1988) 1 (2002) 2 – – – 1 (1998) – 1 == All-time table == * Teams highlighted in gold have won a title.
